subject: Photography
title: What Makes a Great Portrait
description: A short lesson to help you apply What Makes a Great Portrait.

hook.text: A great portrait doesn't just show what someone looks like. It reveals who they are.

buildup.text: Portrait photography captures personality, mood, and character â€” not just physical features.

discovery.text: The eyes are the anchor. A sharp, expressive eye draws the viewer in and creates an emotional connection.

twist.text: Technical perfection doesn't guarantee a great portrait. A slightly imperfect shot with genuine emotion always wins.

climax.text: The best portraits make you feel like you know the subject â€” even if you've never met them.

punchline.text: A portrait is a conversation between subject and viewer.

quiz.question: What is the most important element in a portrait?
options: The eyes and the emotional connection they create
